title: Tweet-Tracker
description: A website to track the occurrences of a given keyword on Twitter in real time. This project was built using Python (Flask) as a backend, and React.js and Javascript in the frontend.

title: UCFParking
description: This is an API and website that tracks how full each parking garage is. Every hour, a scrapper scraps UCF's parking site and saves it to an online database. The backend was created using Python (Flask, again) and the frontend, JavaScript.

title: MotionPy
description: A motion detection system using a Raspberry Pi 3, camera module, breadboard, some paper clips and a top-of-the-line cardboard box. A Python server (surprise surprise, it's Flask again) running on the Raspberry Pi sends an Android app, written in Java and Kotlin, a notification and a picture when movement is detected. Images are saved online via Firebase.
